intro: Desmos elegans, commonly known as the elegant desmotis, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine, soft hairs. Desmos elegans is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
